instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message:
Got this Mac Mini today with a ripped of fan connector, not on the logic board but from the fan wires. I have taken the connector of an old A1278 fan but I can't tell which pin goes where.
I have tried some different places now an got the fan to spin but I don't know if tach and controller pins are correct.
The fan spins high all the time now. The hard drive is also missing one of the thermal sensors (the one not connected to the SATA plug). I know this could be the fan issue as well as I have only taken a sensor from an old iMac to try. Can I replace the sensor with a resistor for testing?

I know I could just buy a new fan and thermal sensor but I would like to verify that everything works before ordering.

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message:
Sorry, found the fan pin-out now. I just remembered that I have a running 2012 mini :)
Still need help with the thermal sensors.

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: Hmm, strange. Now the fan doesn't spin at all. Did the pin-out exactly as the other Mac Mini. In ASD all temperature readings are okey, so the old iMac sensor probably works as it should.

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: Just put in the fan from the 2012 Mini and the fan spins like crazy. ASD also says "Motor is spinning faster than it should".

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: Get another fan or swap it with your 2012 machine.

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: I have just swapped it with the 2012 now, but the fan spins like crazy

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: ASD does not report any thermal problems, only that the fan spins to fast

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message:
Just an update here. It seems the circuit for controlling the fan has a defect of some sort. I have downloaded SMC fan control and whatever I do the fan runs full speed, I can't control it at all.
I'm really struggling finding schematics and boardview files for this motherboard as well. Do anyone know if the fan is controlled by the SMC or should I look elsewhere?

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: There are no files for this. All fan control is the same on Apple boards. Just look at how it works on a 2915 board. Could be the feedback trace, so SMC is not seeing the fan tacho and gives it full PWM signal.

threads.title: 820-2577 Fan pinout
threads.message: Okei, thank you, I'll try to find it on the board then
